questions.skill: Interpret data presented in charts or graphs within a text
questions.question:
A study tracked the reading habits of 500 adults over five years. In Year 1, participants read an average of 8 books. By Year 3, the average had risen to 12 books, and by Year 5, it reached 15 books. The researchers attributed this increase to the growing availability of e-books and audiobooks.

Based on the data, which statement is most accurate?
questions.correct_answer: The average number of books read increased by approximately 88% from Year 1 to Year 5
wrong_answers: Reading rates doubled between Year 1 and Year 5
The increase in reading was greatest between Year 3 and Year 5
Participants read fewer physical books each year of the study
questions.explanation: From 8 to 15 books is an increase of 7 books, which is 7/8 = 87.5%, approximately 88%. Reading did not double (would need to reach 16). The increase from Y1-Y3 was 4 books while Y3-Y5 was 3 books, so the greatest increase was early. The passage doesn't specify physical vs. digital formats.
